sentences.en: A mother who already has non-identical twins is more likely to conceive another set of twins.
sentences.cn: 生育过非同卵双胞胎的母亲再怀上双胞胎的可能性更大。

sentences.en: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.cn: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.en: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.cn: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.en: He was immensely ambitious but unable to conceive of winning power for himself.
sentences.cn: 他雄心勃勃，但是想不出自己能如何赢得权力。

sentences.en: I can hardly conceive of your doing such a thing.
sentences.cn: 我很难想象你会做出这种事情.

sentences.en: I can not conceive of such cruelty as to take a child away from its mother.
sentences.cn: 我真不能想象,竟有把孩子从他母亲手里夺走这种残酷行为.

sentences.en: I cannot conceive of anybody writing a play by sitting down and mapping it out.
sentences.cn: 我想象不出有谁能闭门造车写出剧本。

sentences.en: I cannot conceive of such a thing happening again.
sentences.cn: 我不能想像这种事会再发生.

sentences.en: I could not conceive of anybody using it for a title.
sentences.cn: 我简直想像不到任何人会用它来做题目.

sentences.en: I could not conceive that he would do such a silly thing.
sentences.cn: 我不能想像他竟会干这种傻事.

sentences.en: I just can't even conceive of that quantity of money.
sentences.cn: 那么多钱，我根本都无法想象。

sentences.en: It is simply a fantastic imagination to conceive that one can master a foreign language overnight.
sentences.cn: 幻想在一天早晨就把外语学好,那只是白日作梦.

sentences.en: It's difficult to conceive of traveling to the moon.
sentences.cn: 难以想象到月球旅行会是什么样子.

sentences.en: Scientists first conceived the idea of the atomic bomb in the 1930’s.
sentences.cn: 在20世纪30年代，科学家第一次有了原子弹的设想。

sentences.en: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.cn: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.en: She was unable to conceive a child naturally and was offered fertility treatment.
sentences.cn: 她因不能自然怀孕而接受受孕治疗.

sentences.en: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.cn: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

sentences.en: They could not conceive of the possibility of failure.
sentences.cn: 他们想不到失败的可能性.

sentences.en: We conceive of the family as being in a constant state of change.
sentences.cn: 我们认为家庭处于不断变化之中。

sentences.en: We could not conceive that they would do such a silly thing.
sentences.cn: 我们无法想象他们会办出这样的蠢事.

sentences.en: Women, he says, should give up alcohol before they plan to conceive.
sentences.cn: 他说女人在计划怀孕前应该戒酒。

trans.tran_en: to think of a new idea, plan etc and develop it in your mind

trans.tran_cn: 构想出， 设想； 怀孕
trans.tran_en: to imagine a particular situation or to think about something in a particular way
to think of a new idea, plan etc and develop it in your mind
